bestie.desc: They lack any aggression at all. Using their tail as a lure, they invite other Beasties into their burrow to offer them food.
bestie.name: Diggum

recruit.description: Fulfill recruit conditions for 2+ of this Beasties' allies

bilby1.desc: Their busy mind is only at rest while they dig. They'll hyperfocus for days on a single burrow.
bilby1.name: Bildit

bilby2.desc: Following fires, rockslides, or other natural disasters, Handicoots often appear and help out.
bilby2.name: Handicoot

cassowary1.desc: Anytime they encounter something new, they kick it. Kicking is their way of understanding the world.
cassowary1.name: Kichik

recruit.description: Hit this Beastie with an attack that has 60 POW or more

cassowary2.desc: Despite their powerful legs they insist on using their head for everything. As a result they have frequent headaches and are usually grumpy.
cassowary2.name: Ostrisigh

recruit.description: Hit this Beastie with an attack that has 80 POW or more

cheerleader.desc: Its fluff is made of incredibly thin strands of wax, bundled like wool. If a Cherrily makes you a pom, it considers you a treasured friend.
cheerleader.name: Cherrily

cheerleader1.desc: It's extremely light and drifts with air currents. Groups of Merrifly will hold onto each other so as not to drift apart.
cheerleader1.name: Merrifly

dog1.desc: They are obsessed with chasing balls. It's said that they see the moon itself as a giant Beastieball which they yearn to chase.
dog1.name: Wagdash

dragonfly.desc: Their bodies are made from hard transluscent chitin. Depending on the arrangment of their cells, they refract light differently and can appear as vastly different colors.
dragonfly.name: Kaleidarn

frog1.desc: They crave attention. They can hardly spend time with their own kind because they compete for an audience.
frog1.name: Axolati

recruit.description: Boost any [sprIcon,0][sprIcon,1][sprIcon,2]POW [sprBoost,0][sprBoost,0][sprBoost,0] or more on a Beastie

frog2.desc: They are constantly, restlessly performing. If anyone around them isn't happy it only encourages them further.
frog2.name: Hopsong

recruit.description: Boost any [sprIcon,0][sprIcon,1][sprIcon,2]POW [sprBoost,0][sprBoost,0][sprBoost,0][sprBoost,0] or more on a Beastie

horseshoe.desc: An ancient Beastie that has hardly changed in 400 million years. Their ability to play Beastieball both on land and deep undersea has allowed them to thrive through climate shifts.
horseshoe.name: Xiphosaur

kangaroo1.desc: They are skilled at mimicry and can even learn human words. They especially favor sounds which get a rise out of others.
kangaroo1.name: Rookee

lyrebird1.desc: They are constantly in motion. Their colorful plumage is a point of pride and they sometimes accessorize it with flower petals.
lyrebird1.name: Sefren

magpie1.desc: They identify themselves through song. Tight cliques will often form around a common melody.
magpie1.name: Punkchirp

moth.desc: They can manipulate emotions with potent pheromones. Anyone who touches their mask, made from all the material they collected as a pupa, will face their wrath.
moth.name: Plumask

moth1.desc: Their spines naturally collect plant detritus as they move about, building up their protective coat.
moth1.name: Collarva

moth2.desc: This Beastie hides in its cocoon and pilots a constructed decoy. They build masks and experiment with personas they might grow into.
moth2.name: Wormask

nerd1.desc: They make their home in office desks where they can readily access their favorite food: paper. Math homework is especially enticing for them.
nerd1.name: Calcroach

recruit.description: Have this Beastie survive an attack with 50 POW or more

platypus1.desc: They use their bill to detect electrical fields. They heavily rely on this sense while the rest of their body develops.
platypus1.name: Platenna

recruit.description: Boost [sprIcon,2]DEF [sprBoost,0][sprBoost,0] or more on a Beastie

platypus2.desc: They have honed their electroreceptive sensitivity, allowing them to foresee the movements of other Beasties.
platypus2.name: Platypulse

recruit.description: Boost [sprIcon,2]DEF [sprBoost,0][sprBoost,0][sprBoost,0] or more on a Beastie

possum1.desc: Their semitransparent ears shield their eyes from wind as they glide. They feel safest in large groups, especially with watchful Sefren.
possum1.name: Shooga

possum2.desc: They can hear the footsteps of distant predators. They'll hide for as long as it takes for danger to pass.
possum2.name: Supassum

rocklizard1.desc: They enjoy basking in the sun, but this leaves them vulnerable. They stick out their tongue to intimidate predators.
rocklizard1.name: Skibble

recruit.description: Boost [sprIcon,0]DEF [sprBoost,0][sprBoost,0] or more on a Beastie

serval.desc: They leap high enough to snatch birds straight out of the sky. They'll leave claw marks on high places as a form of competition.
serval.name: Servace

recruit.description: Attack 3+ times from the front lane

serval1.desc: When on the hunt, they'll often allow prey to escape so that they can continue the chase and practice their pounce more.
serval1.name: Servitt

recruit.description: Attack 2+ times from the front lane

shroom1.desc: Its body is covered in microscopic fungal feelers, making it feel sticky. They tend to all varieties of plant life.
shroom1.name: Sprecko

recruit.description: Create any type of field effect

spirit1.desc: They fly tirelessly through any condition to find flowers to feed on. Seeing one is considered a lucky charm.
spirit1.name: Humflit

swift.desc: The fastest known flier of all. They use echolocation to rapidly navigate narrow cave systems.
swift.name: Blitzwift

tricky1.desc: Their life cycle begins in caves, but they journey to the forest in adulthood. Each one selects a companion rock who they talk to as though it were alive.
tricky1.name: Troglum

recruit.description: WIPE OUT this Beastie with a SIDEWAYS attack

yeti.desc: Once thought to be solitary creatures. It was discovered they communicate with one another across mountain peaks with reflected light from the lens on their head.
yeti.name: Yamyth
